attributes.comment:
Whom concern,

I'd like to express how scared I'm knowing that the Immigration Service is planning
to raise the fees charged for the Citizenship process.
I really don't see that initiative as something positive, otherwise I see that as a
very negative project for many reasons. First of all, and mainly, because of the low
posibilities offered to immigrants to work in US. at this point, I'm talking about a
clerical/administrative job, since to find a professional job can represents a really
challenge for those who came from their country planning to restart their lives in
US.
The bottom line is....for most part of the time, people who have a strong
background and a good academic level find themselves working in a position
(when can find a job in his specific professional area) pretty much in low
level...doing less intelectual works than he really could be done. thats
means....loww salary, sometimes a lot of work....short time....and a big challenge
to live in US paying to much for utilities, rent, etc.
On another hand....there are many people mwho can't afford living in US and have
been struggling to survive working too much and having a salary that don't allow
them to pay for their main, essential subsistence.
Raise the fee will, for sure, make impossible and or hard for most part of
immigrants living here no matter what's his specific situation.
What's expected by Immigration Service is some kind of support of those who
have being going though many stressful situation related to restarting a new life in
a different country, dealing, sometimes, with the cultural and emotional
shock...that came together with a very stressful financial crisis, for most part of
the time.
On another hand, these justifications presented to raise (and make hard thousand
of people's lifes) just doens't justify, since there are not a main reason and /or
benefits for the candidates.
Finally, to raise fees will raise the number of immigrants living here in illegal
status...and will increase the number of people working in illegal way.....not
paying for Social Security and taxes......bringing trouble to the United States and
it's governments.
Please, realize that trying to make immigrants's lives hard in US can bring bad
consequences for the country's economy. So, be smart and try to punish just
those whom deserve it..not all immigrants, because some are here looking for a
opportunity to contribute in very positive way to make US grow. And...sometimes,
the immigrant are here for something else that envolves being proud of this
country and asshamed of his own political innitiatives..therefore....a lot of people
here deserve to be reward and incentivate to stay here and give their best!
attributes.title: Comment Submitted By Tereza R. Merlo
